paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy (FAP) and mentions the TTR gene variant TTR Met30, but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual case information.

functional_data.summary: The TTR Met30 variant is associated with FAP, characterized by progressive peripheral and autonomic neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is produced predominantly by the liver.
key_quotes: The amyloid protein in type 1 FAP of Portuguese, Swedish and Japanese origin is the variant of transthyretin 8TTR, in which methionine is a substitute for valine at position 30 (TTR Met).

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses the TTR gene variant but lacks detailed penetrance data or individual case information.
